executive_summary: Kayak rental businesses have benefited from demand from health-conscious consumers as sports participation has increased. Consumers have sought out forms of fitness that also provide entertainment and an opportunity to socialize. Several forms of alternative fitness have become popular in recent years, including kayaking, CrossFit and yoga, stimulating demand for rental services. Also, older demographics have become more involved in these alternate forms of exercise, which has provided growth opportunities for rental providers. Still, growth has been relatively modest because of the established nature of kayak rentals.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Revenue is expected to climb at a CAGR of 0.4% to $105.3 million through the end of 2024, including growth of 3.4% in 2024 alone.

Despite growth, intensifying external competition from other forms of fitness has constrained performance because of high price-based competition. Nevertheless, profitability has grown in recent years as kayak rental businesses have invested in expanding their services and offering premium experiences.

To compete with other forms of entertainment and fitness, rental businesses have tried to capitalize on the growing trend of eco-tourism. Customers can rent kayaks and canoes and then explore nature in a sustainable and environmentally friendly way.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Kayak rental providers will continue to grow amid further improvements in the US economy. Since kayaking is considered a form of entertainment, consumers will typically limit discretionary spending on those types of activities during times of high economic uncertainty.

The industry will also benefit from a continued increase in the popularity of kayaking and general paddle sports. Kayaking will continue to grow in popularity because of increasing recognition of the activity as an effective form of exercise.

Growth in per capita disposable income will promote activities like paddling lessons and guided tours, pushing up demand for rentals. Also, leisure time will increase in the coming years, providing consumers with more time to spend kayaking and canoeing.

industry_definition: The Kayak Rental industry rents recreational paddleboats to consumers for hourly or daily use. The industry rents kayaks for recreational, whitewater and sea touring purposes. The industry also rents other types of paddleboats, such as canoes.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level low - steady

opportunities: High Performance Drivers Per capita disposable income
threats: Time spent on leisure and sports

key_trends: The industry has benefited from more health-conscious individuals across the US. Kayaking is a relaxing and enjoyable form of fitness that individuals from an array of age groups can enjoy.
Eco-tourism trends and a growing focus on sustainability have also fueled growth. Kayaks, canoes and paddleboats offer consumers the ability to enjoy nature without damaging local ecosystems.
Kayak rental providers don't benefit from any specific government assistance. The industry does receive some indirect assistance from various related industry associations.

Similar to most industries, rental providers were forced to close during the height of the pandemic. However, sales rebounded quickly once restrictions were lifted since kayaking is a safe way to get outside.
Recreational kayaking services form the backbone of the industry. Most users are looking for a fun and relaxing form of recreation when they visit a kayak rental provider.
Most consumers fall between the ages of 18 and 44. Individuals in this age range tend to be active and have relatively high levels of disposable income.
The price of rentals is a major form of competition. Kayak rental providers must ensure that rental prices are competitive so that customers don't purchase their own equipment instead.

market_segmentation.segment: Consumers aged between 18 and 44 years old

products_and_services.product_or_service: THE POPULARITY OF CANOEING GROWS POST-PANDEMIC
products_and_services.product_description: Canoeing differs from kayaking by giving consumers a larger vehicle that can fit several individuals. Canoeing is popular among families and groups since multiple people can sit in the same canoe and work together while having a great time. Demand for canoe rentals was boosted by the easing of social-distancing restrictions. Consumers were seeking ways to get outside and interact with friends and family, without exposing themselves to the risks of being in a large group.

This segment refers to rentals of kayaks that are used for leisurely kayaking experiences. Recreational kayaking is accessible to individuals across a wide age range and does not require previous experience. Recreational kayaking is popular among groups and individuals who want to engage in a form of fitness or leisure without being exposed to the harsher elements of watersports.
This segment includes whitewater kayaking, surfing while sea kayaking and fishing while kayaking. Whitewater kayaking has a passionate fanbase and tends to attract repeat customers.

tier_1_suppliers: Plastic Products Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Boat Dealership and Repair in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Kayak rental providers endure stiff competition from other forms of entertainment and fitness, including other sports, exercise programs like Pilates and recreation like video games. Individuals in this segment have devoted a growing share of their leisure time to indoor activities, with less time spent outdoors than previous generations. However, participation from this segment has been buoyed by fewer fitness offerings in schools, causing many parents to look for alternatives for their kids. Kayak and canoe rentals offer an affordable and interactive form of recreation that gets kids outside and interacting with the environment.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: INDIVIDUALS AGED 18 TO 44 COMPRISE THE BULK OF THE CUSTOMER BASE
demand_determinants.determinant_description: As individuals age, they often seek engaging forms of exercise that can also double as a form of recreation. Kayaking is a unique activity that combines an effective form of fitness with the ability to interact with others and enjoy nature. This segment accounts for more than 50.0% of the customer base for kayak rental providers, a share that has grown in recent years.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: DEMAND BOOSTED BY CONSUMERS 45 AND OLDER
demand_determinants.determinant_description: In recent years, exercise has become a growing emphasis for older individuals, particularly those over the age of 60. This demographic has helped grow this segment and has also fueled growth in industry revenue. Kayaking also provides individuals with a constructive way to spend a couple of hours, which can be important for retirement-age consumers.

basis_points.basis_title: Price of rentals is a major form of competition
basis_points.basis_description: Kayak rental providers must ensure that rental prices are competitive so that customers don't purchase their own equipment instead.

basis_points.basis_title: External competition from other sports and recreation
basis_points.basis_description: Rental providers endure external competition from other sports and forms of recreation. Rock climbing, basketball, movie theaters and golf are all forms of competition.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases are the largest expense for rental providers. While most merchandise is purchased from sporting goods wholesalers, some rental providers can bypass the wholesaler intermediary and purchase canoes and kayaks directly from manufacturers.

Purchase costs have grown in recent years as inflationary pressure has pushed up prices for an array of goods. Rental providers are also investing in the latest equipment to appeal to a different type of consumer.
Wages are the second-greatest expense for rental providers because other operating costs are relatively low. Workers are essential to rental services.
With purchases growing as a share of revenue in recent years, rental providers have reduced wage outlays to maintain a healthy level of profit.
Workers must be trained to provide guidance to clients regarding safety and operational guidelines. Workers may also transport consumers short distances and conduct guided tours.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Low rate of new patent technologies
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low, which limits the potential for innovations. A low rate does not mean that innovations cannot occur, just that the likelihood of some innovation materializing is low.
The popularity of canoeing grows post-pandemic. Canoeing differs from kayaking by giving consumers a larger vehicle that can fit several individuals.

Recreational kayaking is the cornerstone of the industry. This segment refers to rentals of kayaks that are used for leisurely kayaking experiences. Recreational kayaking is accessible to individuals across a wide age range and does not require previous experience.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Other types of kayaking appeal to avid sportsmen
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: This segment includes whitewater kayaking, surfing while sea kayaking and fishing while kayaking. Whitewater kayaking has a passionate fanbase and tends to attract repeat customers.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Consumers are price-conscious so they will choose other forms of entertainment or fitness if the price of kayak rentals becomes too high. As consumers' per capita disposable income rises, they can spend more on leisure without having to reduce spending in other areas.

Strong growth in entertainment options in recent years has kept competition high. Volatility has increased in recent years as rental providers fight to capture a share of consumers' disposable income.
